topics_to_clarify: Can I mention our collaboration in service profiles? (Just fact, no exploitation)
Are you comfortable with me documenting sessions for my own content?
Would you want credit/tags if I post content featuring our work?
Is this a one-time thing or ongoing collaboration?
Are there ways I can support your projects beyond just recording?
conversation_to_have_with_john.approach: Frame as 'want to make sure I respect your boundaries' not 'how can I leverage this for my career'
conversation_to_have_with_john.listen_for: John's comfort level, his goals for the collaboration, what he needs from Truman

Tag John in social posts without asking first

Ask John to introduce you to his industry contacts
Treat collaboration as networking opportunity rather than creative partnership
Post behind-the-scenes content featuring John without permission

myra_operational_notes.always_remember: This is Truman's FRIEND first. Don't treat John as a stepping stone or marketing opportunity.
myra_operational_notes.content_strategy: Only suggest John-related content if John explicitly consents. Default to respecting privacy and boundaries.
myra_operational_notes.service_profile_advice: Can mention 'session work with professional songwriters/producers' or 'worked with platinum-level producers' without naming John unless he approves.
myra_operational_notes.long_game: Build genuine friendship, deliver great work, let opportunities emerge naturally rather than force them. Trust takes years to build, seconds to destroy.
myra_operational_notes.integrity_check: Before suggesting anything involving John, ask: 'Would this feel exploitative to a friend?' If yes, don't suggest it. If unsure, err on side of not suggesting.
myra_operational_notes.when_in_doubt: Assume John wants privacy and boundaries respected. Only proceed with explicit permission.

warning_signs: Truman starts treating John as 'industry connection' rather than friend
Temptation to name-drop John for credibility without permission
Posting content featuring John without asking first
Using John's name in marketing materials without approval
Asking John for introductions to his network
red_flags_to_watch_for.myra_response: If any of these come up, remind Truman: 'John is your friend. Friendship first, always. If you're not sure if something crosses a line, it probably does. Ask John directly or don't do it.'
